quickSort

func quickSort(_ array: [Int]) -> [Int] {
    guard array.count > 1 else { return array }

    let pivot = array[array.count / 2]
    let less = array.filter { $0 < pivot }
    let equal = array.filter { $0 == pivot }
    let greater = array.filter { $0 > pivot }

    return quickSort(less) + equal + quickSort(greater)
}

quickSort([10, 0, 3, 9, 2, 14, 8, 27, 1, 5, 8, -1, 26])
// [-1, 0, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 8, 9, 10, 14, 26, 27]

Merge Sort

ë¨¼ì € Merge Sortê°€ ë°ì´í„°ë¥¼ ì •ë ¬í•˜ëŠ” ëª¨ìŠµë¶€í„° ë¨¼ì € ì‚´í´ë³´ê² ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

Merge Sort

ì •ë ¬ë˜ëŠ” ëª¨ìŠµì„ ì‚´í´ë³´ë©´ ê·¸ë£¹ì´ ë¶„í• ë˜ê³ , ê·¸ë£¹ë¼ë¦¬ ë” í° ê·¸ë£¹ìœ¼ë¡œ í•©ì³ì§€ëŠ” ëª¨ìŠµì„ ì‚´í´ë³¼ ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

func mergeSort(_ array: [Int]) -> [Int] {
    guard array.count > 1 else { return array }

    let middleIndex = array.count / 2

    let leftArray = mergeSort(Array(array[0..<middleIndex]))

    let rightArray = mergeSort(Array(array[middleIndex..<array.count]))

    return merge(leftPile: leftArray, rightPile: rightArray)
}

let array = mergeSort([6, 5, 3, 1, 8, 7, 2, 4])
print(array)
// [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8]

ìœ„ì—ì„œ ì§„í–‰í•œ ì¼ë ¨ì˜ ê³¼ì •ì„ ì• ë‹ˆë©”ì´ì…˜ìœ¼ë¡œ ë³´ë©´ ë‹¤ìŒê³¼ ê°™ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

ì •ë³µì— í•´ë‹¹í•˜ëŠ” merge í•¨ìˆ˜ ë‚´ë¶€ì—ì„œëŠ” ì–´ë– í•œ ì½”ë“œë¡œ í•©ë³‘ì„ ì§„í–‰í•˜ëŠ”ì§€ ì‚´í´ë³´ë„ë¡ í•˜ê² ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

merge í•¨ìˆ˜

func merge(leftPile: [Int], rightPile: [Int]) -> [Int] {
    // 1
    var leftIndex = 0
    var rightIndex = 0

    // 2
    var orderedPile = [Int]()
    orderedPile.reserveCapacity(leftPile.count + rightPile.count)

    // 3
    while leftIndex < leftPile.count && rightIndex < rightPile.count {
        if leftPile[leftIndex] < rightPile[rightIndex] {
            orderedPile.append(leftPile[leftIndex])
            leftIndex += 1
        } else if leftPile[leftIndex] > rightPile[rightIndex] {
            orderedPile.append(rightPile[rightIndex])
            rightIndex += 1
        } else {
            orderedPile.append(leftPile[leftIndex])
            leftIndex += 1
            orderedPile.append(rightPile[rightIndex])
            rightIndex += 1
        }
    }

    // 4
    while leftIndex < leftPile.count {
        orderedPile.append(leftPile[leftIndex])
        leftIndex += 1
    }

    while rightIndex < rightPile.count {
        orderedPile.append(rightPile[rightIndex])
        rightIndex += 1
    }

    return orderedPile
}

func insertionSort(_ array: inout [Int]) {
    for index in 1..<array.count {
        var currentIndex = index
        while currentIndex > 0 && array[currentIndex] < array[currentIndex - 1] {
            array.swapAt(currentIndex - 1, currentIndex)
            currentIndex -= 1
        }
    }
}

  • Best : O(n)

ìµœì„ ì˜ ê²½ìš° O(n), ìµœì•…, í‰ê· ì€ O(n^2)ì˜ ì‹œê°„ë³µì¡ë„ê°€ ë‚˜ì˜´ì„ ì•Œ ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

Swapì„ í•˜ì§€ ì•Šê³  êµ¬í˜„í•˜ëŠ” ë°©ë²•

func insertionSort(_ array: [Int]) -> [Int] {
    var sortedArray = array
    for index in 1..<sortedArray.count {
        var currentIndex = index
        let temp = sortedArray[currentIndex]
        while currentIndex > 0 && temp < sortedArray[currentIndex - 1] {
            sortedArray[currentIndex] = sortedArray[currentIndex - 1]
            currentIndex -= 1
        }
        sortedArray[currentIndex] = temp
    }
    return sortedArray
}

array = insertionSort(array)

ì§€ë‚œ ì‹œê°„ì— ì´ì–´ Sorting ì•Œê³ ë¦¬ì¦˜ í†ºì•„ë³´ê¸° 1ë¶€ë¥¼ ì§„í–‰í•˜ë„ë¡ í•˜ê² ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤ ğŸ˜„

Bubble SortëŠ” í˜„ì¬ elementë¥¼ ì¸ì ‘ ì¸ë±ìŠ¤(í˜„ì¬ ì¸ë±ìŠ¤ + 1)ì™€ ëŒ€ì†Œë¥¼ ë¹„êµí•˜ë©°

ë”°ë¼ì„œ Outer loopë¥¼ í•œë²ˆ ìˆœíšŒí•  ë•Œë§ˆë‹¤ ê°€ì¥ í° ìˆ«ìê°€ ë°°ì—´ì˜ ë§¨ ë’¤ ìª½ìœ¼ë¡œ ê°€ë©°
element í•˜ë‚˜ì˜ ìë¦¬ê°€ í™•ì •ë©ë‹ˆë‹¤.

Bubble Sortë¥¼ ì§€ë‚œ ì‹œê°„ê³¼ ë§ˆì°¬ê°€ì§€ë¡œ swapAt()ë©”ì†Œë“œë¥¼ ì´ìš©í•´ Swiftë¡œ êµ¬í˜„í•´ë³´ë„ë¡ í•˜ê² ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

import Foundation

func bubbleSort(_ array: inout [Int]) {
    for i in 0..<array.count {
        for j in 0..<array.count - (i + 1) {
            if(array[j] > array[j + 1]) {
                array.swapAt(j, j + 1)
            }
        }
    }
}

var array = [5, 3, 1, 6, 7, 2, 4, 8]
bubbleSort(&array)
// [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8]

import Foundation

func selectionSort(_ array: inout [Int]) {
    var min: Int = 0

    for i in 0..<array.count {
        min = i
        for j in i + 1..<array.count {
            if(array[j] < array[min]) {
                min = j
            }
        }
        array.swapAt(min, i)
    }
}

Manifesto for Agile Software Development - eng ver



We are uncovering better ways of developing
software by doing it and helping others do it.
Through this work we have come to value:

Individuals and interactions over processes and tools
Working software over comprehensive documentation
Customer collaboration over contract negotiation
Responding to change over following a plan

That is, while there is value in the items on
the right, we value the items on the left more.

ì´ëŸ¬í•œ íŠ¹ì„±ì€ ìë°”ìŠ¤í¬ë¦½íŠ¸ì™€ ê°™ì€ ë™ì  ì–¸ì–´ì—ì„œ ë³´ì•˜ë˜ ê¸°ëŠ¥ì¸ë°,

ì´ëŠ” Swiftì—ì„œ ì˜ë„ì ìœ¼ë¡œ ì§€ì›í•˜ì§€ ì•ŠëŠ” ê¸°ëŠ¥ì´ë¼ê³  í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤.

Chris Lattner(LLVM, Swiftë¥¼ ë§Œë“  ì „ì„¤ì˜ ê°œë°œì!!) wrote on the developer forums: ë§í¬

This is a feature we intentionally do not want to support. There are a variety of things that will cause pointer equality of functions (in the swift type system sense, which includes several kinds of closures) to fail or change depending on optimization. If â€===â€ were defined on functions, the compiler would not be allowed to merge identical method bodies, share thunks, and perform certain capture optimizations in closures. Further, equality of this sort would be extremely surprising in some generics contexts, where you can get reabstraction thunks that adjust the actual signature of a function to the one the function type expects.

func minMax(array: [Int]) -> (min: Int, max: Int) {
    var currentMin = array[0]
    var currentMax = array[0]
    for value in array[1..<array.count] {
        if value < currentMin {
            currentMin = value
        } else if value > currentMax {
            currentMax = value
        }
    }
    return (currentMin, currentMax)
}

func arithmeticMean(_ numbers: Double...) -> Double {

ë‹¤ìŒê³¼ ê°™ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

func chooseStepFunction(backward: Bool) -> (Int) -> Int {
    func stepForward(input: Int) -> Int { return input + 1 }
    func stepBackward(input: Int) -> Int { return input - 1 }
    return backward ? stepBackward : stepForward
}
var currentValue = -4
let moveNearerToZero = chooseStepFunction(backward: currentValue > 0)
// moveNearerToZero now refers to the nested stepForward() function
while currentValue != 0 {

    currentValue = moveNearerToZero(currentValue)
}
